pros: Great pay, benefits, and paid holidays
cons: As a new employee not from the area I didn’t feel welcome for a while

pros: Decent benefits. Unique student population. Easy work.
cons: Gender based harassment and pay inequality. Lack of upward movement or growth. HR does not follow protocol and lacks transparency so be sure to look out for yourself. Asking too many questions about compensation discrepancies and asking for a raise while doing multiple roles because of short staffed office will result in being pushed out.

pros: Salary and Benefits are good
cons: Do not promote within, moral is low, not encouraged to learn other jobs

pros: Competitive Benefits and opportunities for advancement
cons: Not a lot of support from the management

review_title: Only good if you're in the vclub
pros: Nice supervisor, good town without too many troubles.
cons: Can't work from home (unless you're a dean), inconsistent application of policies, poor raises compared to competing institutions.

review_title: Wants so much, cares about you little
pros: Nice supervisor, beautiful campus, safe
cons: Inconsistencies in policies being applied, unfairnesses across departments, pay goes down each year because of cutbacks. New responsibilities keep being added and demanded with no extra compensation for all of that extra time spent.

pros: Nice campus, good benefits, lots of time off.
cons: Little flexibility in compensation or market value adjustments.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Williamsport, PA
pros: Atmosphere, benefits, work/life balance, culture, and paid time off!
cons: Compensation, policies, pay for parking, lack of employee interaction.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Williamsport, PA
pros: Working directly with other students.
cons: The base pay was not a lot of money.

pros: Good student population, decent benefits
cons: Unable to shift into the new format necessary for lack of incoming students and changing learning environment

job_title: Coordinator of Residence Life in Williamsport, PA
pros: You get free housing like all other RD positions
cons: Lack of advancement opportunities, salary doesn’t increase no matter the experience, no support from administration

review_title: It is a good place to work
pros: Benefit is good. Pay is good.
cons: administration is not as good as expected.

review_title: It's all politics and who you know
pros: Decent salaries, nice colleagues to work with
cons: Enrollment management department is useless. Enrollment is declining, and they do nothing about it. You will only get promoted if you are friends with the president and her friends. So inbred. It's not a place where you can hope to advance on your merits at all. Avoid. I wasted a part of my career time here, and I have severe regrets now.

pros: It was a pretty easy place to work with great people.
cons: It was hard to get shifts sometimes due to so many other employees.

job_title: Health Service Assistant in Williamsport, PA
pros: high hourly salary, great facilities
cons: not enough late evening shifts

review_title: A great place to work for students
job_title: Student Tier I Support Analyst in Williamsport, PA
pros: Flexible work hours, friendly environment, good variety of tasks
cons: Low hourly pay to do basically the same work as full time employees

pros: You will occasionally find a like-minded  coworker who genuinely cares for the students (whom the college claim to serve first and foremost).
cons: There are overwhelmingly destructive and toxic methods at work in the upper most level of management (within enrollment management specifically).  Regularly employed scare tactics and paranoia are key reasons why turn over is so alarmingly high, and the majority of employees feel as though they are contestants in an ongoing popularity contest. Working within an Academic department seems to be where you find the most ethical and healthy departments, but I strongly urge everyone to think twice before applying to a position within Enrollment Management or Student Affairs -- as both of these are rendered utterly ineffective by senior most levels of management.

review_title: Great people, great future at the Children's Learning Center.
pros: Great benefits when you are full time. Pay was more than any other child care in the area for a substitute. The staff at the CLC are great to work with.
cons: Since they are a 4 star facility, you must have a bachelor's degree to move to the lead teacher position, or you will be in a substitute or assistant position permanently. Staff rarely leave, so there are rarely openings for full time. Pay is based on other centers, not on the College as a whole.  If you are part time, the college itself only allows you to work 25 hours or less, so you cannot hold two different positions if you are classified as part time because of the hour restrictions.

review_title: PCT is an up and coming competitor in Higher Ed.
pros: The benefits are excellent and the president, Davie Gilmour, has done a terrific job of handling things with the tightening of the higher education budgets in PA and with communicating with employees to eliminate fear and concern. It is not a research school so it is great for those people more interested in teaching than research.
cons: There is still a stigma of the former community college environment surrounding the school which can make it difficult to get recognition outside of the college as a professor in a Bachelor's degree program.  It is not a research school, so it could be difficult moving to another 4-yr institution in certain fields.

review_title: Good organization for a career in region.
pros:
Good reputation for academics in certain specialties
Decent salaries and benefits
Vacation time flexibility
Tuition waivers for employee and family
Great opportunities for professional development if proactive
Great networking with business and industry
cons:
Subject to inconsistent funding if not in a unionized position
Interoffice and college politics if you are not a conformist
Promotion subject to desires of leadership versus actual established interview process (if your boss feels threatened by your abilities or popularity with others you will not advance!)

review_title: Worst place i ever worked for Employee Evaluations
job_title: Dining Services Worker III in Mill Hall, PA
pros: Loved working with students and other employees in a fast paced setting
cons: Never felt appreciated by management, never discreet with confidential matters, and employee evaluations made you feel like crap when any other place I have ever worked believed in pumping you up, not making you feel mediocre at best.

job_title: Dining Service Worker in Williamsport, PA
pros: I work in dining services, so my previous experience has been in restaurants. working at Penn College I love the fact that I do not have to put up with the normal harassment that goes on at most restaurants. there is no sexual harassment from cooks, no catty nastiness from management. the management team are all very team conscious and handle problems that do arise very quickly and respectfully. most of the staff is working moms just trying to have a good day.
cons: There is very little hope for full time employment & benefits.

pros: Good benefits.  Great group of fellow employees.
cons: Promotion is difficult.  Unless you are one of the "selected" ones, forget about advancing. Many positions are never announced.   Inconsistent practices and procedures.  Some people receive special treatment.  Too much favoritism.  It's great for those who are liked or are removed from the politics.  Consistently eliminating positions.  Use fear of losing one's job as a motivator.

job_title: Exempt Non Officer in Williamsport, PA
pros: Great benefits, reasonable schedule, small teams. Hours of work are reasonable, and generally don't exceed 40 per week except in special circumstances.
cons: HR department doesn't follow the consistency they preach; too many political considerations have to go into mundane decisions.

review_title: Generally good culture and great people.
pros: Great people to work with in a good environment. Benefits, time off, and salary are great for the area.
cons: The current administrative leaders seem to make decisions arbitrarily. In Enrollment Management everything is a priority with no assessment and the leadership is toxic. Enrollment has been steadily dropping for over five years under the current leadership, but there is no accountability.

review_title: Best place to work in the area
pros: Relaxed work environment, one of the best paying computer programmer jobs in the area.
cons: Recent changes in benefits have made it pretty good instead of awesome.   Lack of communication from management about employee compensation changes make for some weirdness.

job_title: Program Support Specialist in Williamsport, PA
pros: Working at Penn College is very rewarding, the students create a lot of energy and the benefits are wonderful.  It is a great place to work and earn your degree!
cons: It is difficult to compete with other internal candidates when hoping to move into another position within the institution.

review_title: USE to be a great place to work
pros: Incredible benefits with plenty of vacation days (which you'll need)
cons: Micro managed by too many managers.  You'll spend your whole day doing nothing but filling out daily reports and explaining yourself to 3 managers, and assistant director and the director.  For being a technology college can't understand why people would want to use anything but Windows and makes fun of linux and mac users behind their backs.

job_title: Substitute Worker II in Williamsport, PA
pros: The management are very accommodating to class schedules and other school related activities in relation to work schedules.
cons: Not the highest pay, but is something.

pros: Student population makes it worth going to work every day.
cons: Upper management is bloated and filled with 'friends and neighbors'.

pros:
Oppurtunity to work on homework
Potential to expand Microsoft Office experience and abilities
Friendly Full-time staff
Very willing to work around school schedule and requirements
cons:

review_title: Join and support the growth in the Athletics department
job_title: Personal Fitness Trainer in Williamsport, PA
pros: The school has an enclusive atmosphere and due to its successful job placement and hire rate for graduating students the school will keep growing.
cons: Parking can get difficult for both students and faculty.

pros: I absolutely love my job  here.   If anyone is looking for a part time job as an EMT. I 100% recommend it.
cons: I really have not found any cons yet.  At all, Im serious.

pros: It is a nice atmosphere to work in.
cons: There is nothing working at this moment in time that I see.

pros: being around the students is fun, they keep you young. Benefits such as free college for your children is a plus
cons: Top management has no idea what middle management is doing. It all who you know, not your job performance that matters.

job_title: Dining Service Worker III Line Cook in Williamsport, PA
pros: Decent pay, the dining halls I've worked in have been positive work environments, and great managers
cons: Can get very repetitive, students can be rude and not understanding

job_title: Adjunct Clinical Instructor in Williamsport, PA
pros: Great teamwork, wonderful staff support, loved working with students, opportunities to teach
cons: Low pay due to lots of unpaid time required- grading/meeting with students/meeting with staff/training

I enjoy every day I come into work.
The people are nice.
Learn something new every day.

pros: Make your own schedule, laid back days, very flexible with school schedule
cons: There were no downsides to working for PCT in the Tutoring Center

pros: Supportive management and colleagues. Opportunity for advancement. Great benefits.
cons: Very few cons. Nothing worth mentioning.

pros: Opportunity to take on roles.
